meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed her with vaginosis after examining her symptoms.
meanings.sent2: Vaginosis can cause discomfort and redness in the vaginal area.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her vaginosis made her feel like a fire-breathing dragon.
meanings.sent4: The vaginosis in her body was like a storm brewing in a teacup.
meanings.sent5: The image of vaginosis inflamed her mind like a bright, flashing light.

meanings.definition: A condition characterized by an imbalance of bacteria in the vagina.
meanings.sent1: The medication helped restore the balance disrupted by vaginosis.
meanings.sent2: Vaginosis can occur when the good bacteria in the vagina decrease.
meanings.sent3: She compared the battle of good and bad bacteria in her vagina to a tug-of-war game.
meanings.sent4: The vaginosis imbalance was like a seesaw tipping too far to one side.
meanings.sent5: The concept of vaginosis imbalance was as clear as a black-and-white picture.

meanings.definition: An infection or irritation of the vagina.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed antibiotics to treat her vaginosis infection.
meanings.sent2: Vaginosis irritation can cause itching and burning sensations.
meanings.sent3: She felt like her vaginosis was throwing a tantrum inside her.
meanings.sent4: The vaginosis infection was like a tiny intruder causing chaos.
meanings.sent5: The sensation of vaginosis was as annoying as a buzzing mosquito.
